            BI Engineer at Wavicle Data Solutions. Joined Wavicle to work as a R/R Shiny Developer for a large modeling project. Also enjoy coding in Python and expanding my knowledge of cloud architecture. I’m happiest at work when I spend time figuring out elegant solutions to technical problems.
            My background is environmental sciences / renewable energy / spatial data modeling. I most recently worked in energy efficiency consulting where I interacted with energy data with various tools.
            I’m most excited by learning and building new things. I enjoy working with raspberry pis in my free time and creating things with hardware as opposed to software.
            Outside of work I am also a dad, which takes up much of my free time. I like to ride my bike through the city streets whenever I can.
            I hold a bachelor’s degree in natural resources from Oregon State University and a master’s degree in environmental sciences and management from Humboldt State University as well as a graduate certificate in GIS from Portland State University.

articles.title: Past Projects
articles.description: A short description of the post.
articles.contents:
The following are projects created with plain HTML and JS for a personal website that went largely unfinished. They are hosted through github and it never made sense to port them over to this site. These projects were just for fun when I discovered web development but I’m still happy with them years later.
### NBA Chart JS
Interactive chart made with Chart JS and data processing/web scraping with R. Compares NBA players on a couple different stats.
NBA Map
external_link: https://mxblsdl.github.io/nba_fission/ image: caption: Preview Image focal_point: Smart summary: Interactive map of NBA arenas made entirely with JS. Data processing with R
Radio Coverage
external_link: https://mxblsdl.github.io/urls/or_radio/ image: caption: Preview Image focal_point: Smart summary: Recreation of a Carto DB map showing coverage for basketball radio
Voting Power
external_link: https://mxblsdl.github.io/urls/voting_power.html image: caption: Preview Image focal_point: Smart summary: Exercise in Chart JS, Leaflet, and a little D3 showing relative voting power of different states
CA Agriculture
external_link: https://mxblsdl.github.io/urls/ag.html title: California Agriculture summary: The beta interface to a biomass power study concerning agriculture in California. The details of the project can be hard to explain, but I think this is a nice use of Chart.js and leaflet to display data.
